= Default values =

Default values of XML elements and XML attributes can be defined in mapping configuration:

{{{
@RootElement
class Root {

    @Attribute(defaultValue = "1")
    public int one;

    @Attribute(defaultValue = "2")
    public int two;

    @Element
    public String a;

    @Element(defaultValue = "2")
    public int b;

    @Element(defaultValue = "3")
    public Integer c;
}
}}}

when deserializing this XML:

{{{
<root one="">
    <a>some value</a>
    </b>
</root>
}}}

You would get this values:

{{{
root.one == 1 // false
root.two == 2 // true

root.a.equals("some value") // true
root.b == 2 // true
root.c == null // false
}}}

Rule of thumb is: default attribute values apply when attributes are missing, and default element values apply when elements are empty.
